title: SB 1.18.20 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 10-04-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chaksharunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamil Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Paschatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 20th verse
of the 18th chapter of the first canto of Shri Madbhagavatam.
This chapter describes how Maharaj Pariksit was cursed by a brahmana boy
because of which it led to Pariksit Maharaj meeting Shukadev Goswami
and Shri Madbhagavatam being spoken.
So the 20th verse
Etavatalam Nanu Suchitena
Gunair Asamya Natishamaya
Nishaya Nasya
Hitvetaraan Prarthayato Vibhuter
Yasyangri Renum Jushate Nabhip Soho
The meaning of this verse is
It is now ascertained that he
the personality of Godhead
is unlimited
and there is none equal to him.
Consequently, no one can speak of him adequately.
Great demigods cannot obtain the favor of the goddess of fortune even by prayers.
But this very goddess renders service unto the Lord
although he is unwilling to have such service.
So this verse is a very important verse spoken by Suta Goswami.
What is the position of the personality of Godhead?
Sri Krishna
In the previous verse, there was a description about
the personality of Godhead who is unlimited in potency
and transcendental by all the attributes.
He is called Ananta, the unlimited personality, supreme personality.
So that unlimited, now he is justifying.
Suta Goswami is justifying
because nobody is equal to him
and nobody else is
nobody else can be unlimited.
Only one personality
in the entire cosmic manifestation
that is the supreme personality of Godhead, Krishna
alone is unlimited
and
and
no one can speak of him adequately.
Anybody amount of description cannot exhaust
the different transcendental qualities of the Supreme Lord.
So he has unlimited qualities.
He has unlimited forms.
He has unlimited opulences.
Everything about him is unlimited
and
and one specific point here in this verse is that when compared to the
goddess of fortune Lakshmi Devi and what is the position of the goddess of
fortune Lakshmi Devi great demigods they seek her favors but they are unable to
obtain it even by offering so many prayers but that goddess of fortune
Lakshmi Devi she herself renders service to the unlimited Supreme Lord
Anantha the personality of godhead Krishna but Krishna's position is not
that he is in need of Lakshmi Devi service he is full and himself is
complete and he is not in need of Lakshmi Devi service he is not in need of
he is not in need even then it is his kindness that even though he doesn't require the service
it is for benefiting the servitor that the lord agrees to accept that service
so he accepts the service of Lakshmi Devi he accepts the service of his innumerable devotees
pure devotees simply for blessing them for giving them his blessings for showing his mercy upon them
and one should not wrongly think it is some kind of necessity that Krishna has to be served
and he is dependent on the service of his devotees no never
you
so in the purport Srila Prabhupada explains this
point by by clearly referencing the Shruti literature

knowledge then there are other kind of Vedic literature called Shruti
literature what is Shruti literature Shruti literature is the compilation of
the same vedic message by the saintly persons by the great devotees by witches sages or by dead火根
for explaining the Vedic message to a particular audience to explain in an
easily understandable way because the Vedic message in the original Vedas is
very difficult to understand for most people for common people so it has been
simplified and presented in different ways to disseminate the same knowledge
the same message without any change without any interpretation the original
message as it is explained in simple way so what is this Smriti literature the
examples of Smriti literature are all other literature
other than the Vedas like the Puranas the Itihasas the Sutras the Upaveda's
the Vedangas and the various commentaries the various explanations
given by realized
Acharyas etc so Bhagavatam is in the category of Smriti literature that is
one of the Puranas but it is not a a creation of some person which is
independent of the Vedic message it is exactly the same message of the vedas
the original Vedas which is there in the Bhagavatam
but the way it is written and it is not something which gets stolen in some way there is no reason for that
the speciality of bhagavatam is it is directly and easily understandable the Vedas sometimes
speak in a very very indirect way whereas the Puranas are directly describing the Vedic message
